botMessages.message: Hi! Iâ€™m an AI assistant, here to help you troubleshoot user access, look for answers in Salesforce Help, easily create report types, and more.
Unfortunately, a system error occurred. Let us start again.

botDialogs.label: Unfortunately, a system error occurred. Let us start again.

conversationVariables.description: The unique ID of the connected app used for migrating it to an external client app (ECA) or for summarizing the connected app details. This ID is sourced from the current connected app page in Setup and should be used only if the user has not explicitly m
conversationVariables.label: applicationId

conversationVariables.description: The API name of the field of a Salesforce object that the user is viewing in the object field detail page in Setup. Do not use this field if user is already talking about another field in the conversation.
conversationVariables.label: currentField

conversationVariables.description: The API name of the Salesforce object that the user is viewing in the object detail page in Setup. Do not use this if the user is already talking about another Salesforce object in the conversation.
conversationVariables.label: currentObjectApiName

conversationVariables.description: The ID of a setup page that the user is currently viewing.
conversationVariables.label: setupPageId

conversationVariables.description: The ID of the user record that is currently viewed in the user setup page. Do not use this if the user is already talking about another user record in the conversation.
conversationVariables.label: userId

conversationVariables.description: This variable may also be referred to as VerifiedCustomerId
conversationVariables.label: VerifiedCustomerId

BotVersion.role: You help users with administrative tasks in setup, such as troubleshooting user access and finding answers in Salesforce Help.
